incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Whatsapp Customers Are Unable to Onboard New Senders While Using Twilio Console

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating an issue where some WhatsApp customers are unable to onboard new senders with their preferred display name through the Twilio Console. As a temporary workaround, customers can use the Senders API or continue using the Twilio Console for registration without a preferred display name. Our engineering teams are actively working to resolve the issue, and will have an update within 8 hours.

incidents.name: Messaging Insights Degraded Behavior on Cyber Monday

incident_updates.body: Twilio Messaging Insights was degraded for 5 minutes between 11:18 and 11:24 Pacific Time on 12/1/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced errors loading charts and tables in Messaging Insights. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Impact to Twilio Voice & Messaging Services

incident_updates.body:
Between 09:24 - 09:29 UTC Twilio experienced disruption to Voice and Messaging services in ie1. At this time, all services have recovered and we do not expect any further degradation.

Voice customers with active calls may have experienced call drops or failures to establish call sessions. Failover did take place to minimize impact. Messaging customers may have experienced a delay in message delivery and, in extremely isolated cases, message failure. Retry redundancy took effect to protect traffic.

incidents.name: Issues with Serverless Function Deployment.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Serverless Function Deployment has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 2 Hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are seeing issues with Function deployments. Our engineer are investigating and will keep you posted. Next Update expected in 30 Minutes.

incident_updates.body:
We are continuing to experience intermittent delays in message delivery to T-Mobile Network in the US due to an extended maintenance window on their side, which is temporarily impacting approximately 50% of their capacity.

Impact is expected only around the top of the hour, when traffic volumes are at their highest. Outside of these peak times, traffic is expected to process normally.

We are monitoring the situation closely and working with T-Mobile to obtain updated information during this maintenance window. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Programmable Voice Recordings Completion Delay

incident_updates.body: Programmable Voice Recording was degraded between 10:00 and 16:40 Pacific Time on 12/03/2025. During this period of time call and conference recordings were delayed in completion. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delay to Multiple Networks in Australia

incident_updates.body: SMS delivery to multiple networks in Australia was degraded for 42 minutes between 8:02 and 8:44 Pacific Time on 12/03/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple networks in Australia. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased Latency and Timeouts Across Roles and Realms

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing latency and timeouts issues, Flex is now operating normally at this time. This incident has been resolved.
Twilio Flex Services are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Between 17:45 and 18:04 UTC, we experienced Increased latency and timeouts across roles and realms. Our engineers are working closely with our cloud infrastructure provider to ensure the issue does not recur.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Increased latency and timeouts across roles and realms. Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Flex. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
